Publications

My academic and professional contributions

Here is a list of my published and submitted papers to date. I am also listed on Google Scholar, arXiv, and my ORCID. The codes used in these papers are listed below, some of which are available online.

(7) SpyDust: an improved and extended implementation for modeling spinning dust radiation
Zheng Zhang and Jens Chluba
JCAP03(2025)038; arXiv:2412.03431
(6) RHINO: A large horn antenna for detecting the 21cm global signal
P Bull, A El-Makadema et al.
arXiv:2410.00076
(5) Disentangling the anisotropic radio sky: Fisher forecasts for 21 cm arrays
Zheng Zhang, Philip Bull, Katrine A Glasscock
MNRAS, 530, 3 (2024); arXiv:2403.13768
(4) Hydrogen Intensity and Real-Time Analysis Experiment: 256-element array status and overview
HIRAX collaboration, D Crichton et al.
JATIS, 8, 1 (2022); arXiv:2109.13755
(3) A new MWA limit on the 21 cm power spectrum at redshifts∼ 13–17
MWA collaboration, S Yoshiura et al.
MNRAS, 505, 4 (2021); arXiv:2105.12888
(2) Deep multiredshift limits on Epoch of Reionization 21 cm power spectra from four seasons of Murchison Widefield Array observations
MWA collaboration, Cathryn M Trott et al.
MNRAS, 493, 4 (2020); arXiv:2002.02575
(1) The impact of tandem redundant/sky-based calibration in MWA Phase II data analysis
Zheng Zhang, JC Pober, W Li, BJ Hazelton, MF Morales et al.
PASA.2020.37; arXiv:2009.09269

Codes

Here is a list of available codes used in the papers.

SpyDust

A python package for modeling spinning dust radiation

arXiv:2412.03431

Hydra-TOD

A Gibbs sampling method for single-dish TOD gain calibration and map-making

TIBEC

This is a package for Beam Simulation in Cosmological Coordinates.
